description: PMD Apex AST Nodes - Complete Reference
note: Nodes contain only direct attributes. Inherited attributes are stored once in inheritSchema. Nodes reference parent classes via 'inherits' field.

important_notes.title: Method Node Name
important_notes.content: Use @Image for Method node names, NOT @Name. @Name attribute does not exist for Method nodes.

important_notes.title: Interface vs Inheritance
important_notes.content: Use @InterfaceNames (array) for interfaces, @SuperClassName for inheritance. @SuperClassName is empty string when no superclass exists. For array attributes like @InterfaceNames, use = operator to check membership: @InterfaceNames = 'Database.Batchable'.

important_notes.title: MethodCallExpression
important_notes.content: Use @FullMethodName (NOT @MethodName) for MethodCallExpression. @FullMethodName excludes parentheses (e.g., 'Test.isRunningTest' not 'Test.isRunningTest()'). Use ancestor::Method//MethodCallExpression to search within same method context.

important_notes.title: SoqlExpression vs MethodCallExpression
important_notes.content: SoqlExpression is ONLY created for literal SOQL queries in square brackets (e.g., [SELECT Id FROM Account]). Dynamic queries via method calls (e.g., Database.query(stringVariable)) create MethodCallExpression, not SoqlExpression.

important_notes.title: Test Detection
important_notes.content: Use ModifierNode/@isTest for test classes/methods, NOT contains(@Image, 'Test'). String matching causes false positives. Check both class and method: not(ancestor::UserClass[ModifierNode/@isTest]) and not(ancestor::Method[ModifierNode/@isTest]).

important_notes.title: XPath Node Selection
important_notes.content: XPath must return nodes, not booleans. Place predicates inside node selectors: //Node[@attr = 'value' and condition], NOT //Node[@attr = 'value'] and condition.

important_notes.title: XPath Navigation and String Matching
important_notes.content: Use ancestor::Node for containing context (e.g., ancestor::Method, ancestor::UserClass) and descendant::Node for contained elements. Use string functions on @Image (preserves casing): ends-with(@Image, 'Exception'), contains(@Image, 'Value'). For method-scoped searches: ancestor::Method//MethodCallExpression.

important_notes.title: Try-Catch Block Detection
important_notes.content: Use descendant::TryCatchFinallyBlockStatement to check if a method contains try-catch. Check within method scope, not class scope.

important_notes.title: Empty String Behavior
important_notes.content: When checking for absence, use not(@attr = 'value') for string attributes. For @SuperClassName, empty string means no superclass, so not(@SuperClassName = 'Exception') correctly identifies classes that don't extend Exception.

important_notes.title: Node Type Names
important_notes.content: Use UserClass (not ClassNode) for Apex classes, UserTrigger (not TriggerNode) for triggers. These are the correct node type names in PMD Apex AST.

important_notes.title: Node Attributes and Relationships
important_notes.content: Only use attributes that exist for the specific node type (check AST reference). Non-existent attributes cause XPath to fail silently. Understand parent-child relationships: annotations are descendants of methods, not parents. Use descendant::Annotation within methods: //Method[descendant::Annotation[@Image = 'AuraEnabled']].

important_notes.title: XPath Logic and Negation
important_notes.content: Ensure XPath matches rule intent: use positive conditions for violations (e.g., @ReturnType = 'void'), negative for correct code (e.g., not(@ReturnType = 'void')). Use not(descendant::Node) to check absence. Combine conditions with 'and'. Verify XPath flags violations, not correct code.

attributes.name: @Name
attributes.description: Returns the normalized annotation name for known, valid annotations. The normalized name is in PascalCase. If an unknown annotation is used, the raw name (as in the source code) is returned.

attributes.name: @RawName
attributes.description: Returns the annotation name as it appears in the source code. This allows to verify the casing.

attributes.name: @Image
attributes.description: Returns the annotation name as it appears in the source code. This allows to verify the casing.

attributes.name: @isResolved
attributes.description: Returns the annotation name as it appears in the source code. This allows to verify the casing.

AnnotationParameter.name: AnnotationParameter
AnnotationParameter.description: Represents a parameter of an annotation

attributes.name: @Name
attributes.description: Checks whether this annotation parameter has the given name. The check is done case-insensitive.

BinaryExpression.name: BinaryExpression
BinaryExpression.description: Represents a binary expression (operations with two operands like ==, !=, +, -, &&, ||)

attributes.name: @Type
attributes.description: Returns the target type name of the cast expression.

attributes.name: @Type
attributes.description:
Returns the type name.

This includes any type arguments. (This is tested.) If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Modifiers
attributes.description:
Returns the type name.

This includes any type arguments. (This is tested.) If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Name
attributes.description:
Returns the type name.

This includes any type arguments. (This is tested.) If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Value
attributes.description:
Returns the type name.

This includes any type arguments. (This is tested.) If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @RealLoc
attributes.description:
Returns the type name.

This includes any type arguments. (This is tested.) If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @TypeName
attributes.description:
Returns the type name.

This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @TypeArguments
attributes.description:
This returns the first level of the type arguments. If there are nested types (e.g. {@code List>}), then these returned types contain themselves type arguments.

Note: This method only exists for this AST type and in no other type, even though type arguments are possible e.g. for {@link ASTVariableDeclaration#getType()}.

LiteralExpression.name: LiteralExpression
LiteralExpression.description: Represents a literal value (string, number, boolean, null)

attributes.name: @Name
attributes.description:
Returns the name of this literal when it is labeled in an object initializer with named arguments ({@link ASTNewKeyValueObjectExpression}).

For example, in the Apex code 

{@code new X(a = 1, b = 2) }
, the {@link ASTLiteralExpression} corresponding to {@code 2} will have the {@code name} "{@code b}".

attributes.name: @RealLoc
attributes.description: Internal name used by the synthetic trigger method.

attributes.name: @Image
attributes.description: Internal name used by the synthetic trigger method.

attributes.name: @CanonicalName
attributes.description: Internal name used by the synthetic trigger method.

attributes.name: @QualifiedName
attributes.description: Internal name used by the synthetic trigger method.

attributes.name: @isConstructor
attributes.description: Internal name used by the synthetic trigger method.

attributes.name: @isStaticInitializer
attributes.description: Internal name used by the synthetic trigger method.

attributes.name: @Modifiers
attributes.description: Internal name used by the synthetic trigger method.

attributes.name: @ReturnType
attributes.description: Returns the method return type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Arity
attributes.description: Returns the method return type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @isTriggerBlock
attributes.description: Checks whether this method is the synthetic trigger method.

attributes.name: @MethodName
attributes.description: The {@link Identifier}s that constitute the {@link CallExpression#getReceiver() receiver} of this method call.

attributes.name: @FullMethodName
attributes.description: The {@link Identifier}s that constitute the {@link CallExpression#getReceiver() receiver} of this method call.

attributes.name: @InputParametersSize
attributes.description: The {@link Identifier}s that constitute the {@link CallExpression#getReceiver() receiver} of this method call.

attributes.name: @isTest
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `@isTest` annotation or `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @DeprecatedTestMethod
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @isTestOrTestSetup
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @isWithSharing
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @isWithoutSharing
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @isInheritedSharing
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @isWebService
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @isGlobal
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @isOverride
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

attributes.name: @isVirtual
attributes.description: Returns true if function has `testmethod` modifier

NewKeyValueObjectExpression.name: NewKeyValueObjectExpression
NewKeyValueObjectExpression.description: Represents new key value object expression

attributes.name: @Type
attributes.description: Returns the type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @ParameterCount
attributes.description: Returns the type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Type
attributes.description: Returns the type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Type
attributes.description:
Returns the parameter's type name.

This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Type
attributes.description: Returns the property value's type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Modifiers
attributes.description: Returns the property value's type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @FormatAccessorName
attributes.description: Returns the internal accessor (getter/setter) name of an {@link ASTProperty}. The accessor name is the constant {@link #ACCESSOR_PREFIX} prepended to the name of the property.

attributes.name: @Query
attributes.description: Returns the raw query as it appears in the source code.

attributes.name: @CanonicalQuery
attributes.description: Returns the query with the SOQL keywords normalized as uppercase.

attributes.name: @Query
attributes.description: Returns the raw query as it appears in the source code.

attributes.name: @CanonicalQuery
attributes.description: Returns the query with the SOSL keywords normalized as uppercase.

TryCatchFinallyBlockStatement.name: TryCatchFinallyBlockStatement
TryCatchFinallyBlockStatement.description: Represents try catch finally block statement

attributes.name: @Type
attributes.description: Returns the when block's matching type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

attributes.name: @Name
attributes.description: Returns the when block's matching type name. This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

UserClass.name: UserClass
UserClass.description: Represents an Apex class declaration (Note: Use UserClass, not ClassNode)

attributes.name: @SuperClassName
attributes.description: Returns the name of the superclass of this class, or an empty string if there is none. The type name does NOT include type arguments.

attributes.name: @InterfaceNames
attributes.description: Returns a list of the names of the interfaces implemented by this class. The type names do NOT include type arguments. (This is tested.)

attributes.name: @SuperInterfaceName
attributes.description: Returns the name of the superclass of this class, or an empty string if there is none. The type name does NOT include type arguments.

UserTrigger.name: UserTrigger
UserTrigger.description: Represents an Apex trigger declaration (Note: Use UserTrigger, not TriggerNode)

attributes.name: @Type
attributes.description:
Returns the variable's type name.

This includes any type arguments. If the type is a primitive, its case will be normalized.

VariableExpression.name: VariableExpression
VariableExpression.description: Represents a reference to a variable
